adventure_overview: This Adventure is about America and the powerful symbols that represent the best of our country and how communities come together to help solve problems they are facing.  Citizenship in America is about participation.  One way to show citizenship is by making an impact locally through nonprofit organizations.  Nonprofit organizations are a place for people to give their time, talents, and resources to make a difference in their community.  You, too, can make an impact by participating in a service project that makes your community a better place. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Familiarize yourself with the flag of the United States of America including the history, demonstrating how to raise and lower the flag, how to properly fold and display, and the United States etiquette.

activities.name: Outdoor Flag Ceremony
activities.description: Learn about flag etiquette and how to work with a flag while playing a flag trivia game.

activities.name: Patriotic Guest Speaker
activities.description: Learn about the United States flag and how it’s used from a local patriot.

requirements.text: Identify 3 symbols that represent the United States. Pick your favorite and make a model, work of art, or other craft that depicts the symbol.

activities.name: Paint the Flag
activities.description: Paint a picture of the United States  flag.

activities.name: Statue of Liberty
activities.description: Learn about the Statue of Liberty while building a replica.

activities.name: U.S.A. Symbol Model
activities.description: Using Play-Doh​​®, create a symbol that represents the United States.

activities.name: U.S.A. Symbols Drawing
activities.description: Learn about symbols that represent the United States and create a drawing of your favorite symbol.

activities.name: White House Model
activities.description: Learn about United States symbols and build a model of the White House.

requirements.text: Learn about the mission of any non-profit.  Find out how they fund their activities and how volunteers are used to help.

activities.name: Groups That Help
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn about a nonprofit organization using the internet.

activities.name: Nonprofit Visit
activities.description: Cub Scouts learn about a nonprofit by visiting the organization.

activities.name: 10,000 for the Troops – Bear
activities.description: Cub Scouts participate in a special nation-wide project to create holiday cards for military personnel.  Please have letters mailed to the Scouting America National Service Center by November 7, 2025 .

activities.name: Eyeglasses Donation Drive
activities.description: With your den, host a used eyeglasses drive to donate to an organization that recycles them for those in need.

activities.name: Plant Trees
activities.description: Cub Scouts plant a tree in their community.

activities.name: Scouting for Food Bear
activities.description: Participate in your Council-sponsored Scouting for Food event.
